page.title: 05Grangewaters Water Sports
page.content: Grangewaters is a large lake,which used to be a quarry.It is about 50 feet deep in the middle.The sports that go on at Grangewaters are wind-surfing,canoing,water-skiing, power boat racing and sailing. There is also an observation tower where you can look over the lake and there are some big changing rooms behind the tower. There is lots of wildlife and pondlife at Grangewaters.We saw Water Boatman, Shrips,Great Diving Beetles, Dragon flies, Pond Snails and Water Skaters all around the lake.The birds you can find there are Coot,Grebe and Reed Warblers. Many children from local schools visit the centre to use the facilities and study the wildlife.
